name: Coursera
description: Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 124 million registered learners as of March 31, 2023. Coursera partners with over 300 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including courses, Specializations, Professional Certificates, Guided Projects, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. Institutions around the world use Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students in fields such as data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a Delaware public benefit corporation and a B Corp in February 2021.
features: Quickly learn job skills and industry tools
business_objectives: Accelerate Skill Development and Learning Efficiency
Headline: Learn without limits
ShortDescription: Coursera is one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 124 million registered learners as of March 31, 2023.

Highlights.name: Wide Range of Courses
Highlights.description: Coursera offers a vast selection of courses in various subjects, including Data Science, Business, Computer Science, and more

Highlights.name: Renowned Partners
Highlights.description: They collaborate with prestigious universities and organizations like Stanford and IBM to deliver high-quality educational content

Highlights.name: Flexible Learning Options
Highlights.description: Coursera provides different learning formats, including free courses, paid specializations, and even full degrees, allowing you to choose what suits your needs

enhanced_description: Coursera, launched in 2012 by Stanford Computer Science professors Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, is one of the world's largest online learning platforms, boasting 124 million registered learners as of March 31, 2023. Dedicated to providing universal access to world-class learning, Coursera partners with over 300 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials. This includes a wide range of courses, Specializations, Professional Certificates, Guided Projects, and even bachelor’s and master’s degrees in subjects like Data Science, Business, and Computer Science. It supports organizations globally in their mission to upskill and reskill employees, citizens, and students, with a core business objective to accelerate skill development and learning efficiency. Coursera enables learners to quickly acquire job skills and industry tools, gain new knowledge, and master specific skills through flexible learning options, including free courses, paid specializations, and full degrees. Coursera became a Delaware public benefit corporation and a B Corp in February 2021, emphasizing its commitment to social impact.
key_use_cases: Learning new job skills and industry tools
competitive_advantages: Partnerships with over 300 leading university and industry organizations
Broad catalog of content and credentials (courses, Specializations, Professional Certificates, Guided Projects, bachelor’s and master’s degrees)
High-quality educational content from renowned partners (e.g., Stanford, IBM)
Flexible learning options (free courses, paid programs, full degrees)
